lead_paragraph: Studies show that the ability to perform math problems, as well as handling money matters, are typically one of the first skills to decline in diseases like Alzheimer’s.

headline.print_headline: As Cognition Slips, Financial Skills Are Often the First to Go
headline.main: As Cognition Slips, Financial Skills Are Often the First to Go

snippet: Studies show that the ability to perform math problems, as well as handling money matters, are typically one of the first skills to decline in diseases like Alzheimer’s.
abstract: Retiring column; research shows that ability to solve math problems are usually one of first set of skills to be compromised in those suffering from diseases of the mind, like dementia or Alzheimer's; issue is of particular importance given rapid expansion of cohort of older Americans who will have trouble navigating their personal finances in retirement.
